• A new study shows we're finding new species like never before
• New paper looks at the history of species discovery, where it started, how it's evolved

items.title: More than 200 environmental groups demand halt to new US datacenters
bullets: • Greenpeace, Friends of the Earth, Food & Water Watch and dozens of local groups call for ban on new datacenters in the US

• The facilities’ need for huge amounts of water to cool down equipment has also proved controversial

items.title: A vast oyster reef is about to transform the English coast
bullets: • Europe’s largest restored oyster reef will soon take shape off the coast of Norfolk
• 40,000 specially designed clay structures will be placed on the seabed by the end of 2026
• Each is seeded with about a hundred juvenile oysters that will grow into adults, creating an interconnected reef system

• Australia and the UK also agree to host the first international conference on the topic

• Conservationists feared their populations would be wiped out for decades

items.title: Calibri is too woke for the State Department
bullets: • US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that the Biden-era decision to switch to Calibri typeface in official communications was a “wasteful” diversity move
